column4: is there a way to install say ubuntu server from within a gentoo install?
sure, assuming you can run debootstrap.
do you want to replace gentoo, or what?
yes the gentoo install on the dedi I have access to is completely botched, and I'm tired of dealing with gentoo
do you have grub installed?
let me check
you could easily run unetbootin, but you'd need virtual console access.
oi
that I don't have
what about onto another partition?
there is already 2 partitions, Gentoo is on a 5gb and then I have /home on a 1.5tb partition
https://help.ubuntu.com/community/Installation/FromLinux
you want "without cd"
will this also have ssh setup?
cause I know generally ubuntu doesn't install  sshd by default
not by default, you'll have to sudo apt-get install openssh-server inside the chroot and configure it.
!sshd | NetEcho
ok
uhm lfaraone, without cd install relys on having ubuntu or debian installed,
gentoo doesn't use apt
you don't have debootstrap for gentoo?
